titleStmt.title: A few words to the King and both Houses of Parliament vvorthy their consideration in a weighty concern; to wit, the effect of the execution of the late act, made against meetings and conventicles, so called; through which very many of the innocent people of God have, and do deeply suffer.
titleStmt.author: Milner, Richard, fl. 1675.

notesStmt.note: In response to the Conventicle Act.
Reproduction of the original in the Friends' House Library, London.
